 1453: 
 1454: kex_error(Config) ->
 1455:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1456:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1457:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1458:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1459:     [Kex1,Kex2|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, ssh:default_algorithms()),
 1460:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1461:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1462:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1463:                                               {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex1]}]}
 1464:                                              ]),
 1465:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1466:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(kex_error,
 1467:                            fun(#{msg:={report,#{format:=Fmt,args:=As,label:={error_logger,_}}}}, Pid) ->
 1468:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1469:                                    Pid ! {Ref, lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,As))};
 1470:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1471:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1472:                                    ok % Other msg
 1473:                            end,
 1474:                            self()),
 1475:     try
 1476:         ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1477:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1478:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1479:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1480:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
 1481:                                           {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex2]}]}
 1482:                                          ])
 1483:     of
 1484:         _ ->
 1485:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1486:             ct:fail("expected failure", [])
 1487:     catch
 1488:         error:{badmatch,{error,"Key exchange failed"}} ->
 1489:             %% ok
 1490:             receive
 1491:                 {Ref, ErrMsgTxt} ->
 1492:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1493:                     ct:log("ErrMsgTxt = ~n~s", [ErrMsgTxt]),
 1494:                     Lines = lists:map(fun string:trim/1, string:tokens(ErrMsgTxt, "\n")),
 1495:                     OK = (lists:all(fun(S) -> lists:member(S,Lines) end,
 1496:                                     ["Disconnects with code = 3 [RFC4253 11.1]: Key exchange failed",
 1497:                                      "Details:",
 1498:                                      "No common key exchange algorithm,",
 1499:                                      "we have:",
 1500:                                      "peer have:"]) andalso
 1501:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex1)) =/= nomatch andalso
 1502:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex2)) =/= nomatch),
 1503:                     case OK of
 1504:                         true ->
 1505:                             ok;
 1506:                         false ->
 1507:                             ct:fail("unexpected error text msg", [])
 1508:                     end
 1509:             after 20000 ->
 1510:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1511:                     ct:fail("timeout", [])
 1512:             end;
 1513: 
 1514:         error:{badmatch,{error,_}} ->
 1515:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1516:             ct:fail("unexpected error msg", [])
 1517:     end.
 1518: 
 1519: stop_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1520:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1521:     %% to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1522:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1523:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1524:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1525: 
 1526:     {Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1527: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1528: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1529: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1530: 
 1531:     ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port,
 1532:                                           [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1533:                                            {user, "foo"},
 1534:                                            {password, "morot"},
 1535:                                            {user_interaction, false},
 1536:                                            {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1537:     {ok, ChannelId0} =
 1538:         ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef0, infinity),
 1539: 
 1540:     ssh:stop_listener(Host, Port),
 1541: 
 1542:     {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1543:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1544:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1545: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1546: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1547: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1548: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1549:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef0, ChannelId0,
 1550: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1551:     receive
 1552: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef0,
 1553:          {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1554: 	    ok
 1555:     after 5000 ->
 1556: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1557:     end,
 1558: 
 1559:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(Port, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1560:                                     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1561:                                     {password, "potatis"},
 1562:                                     {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]) of
 1563: 	{Pid1, Host, Port} ->
 1564: 	    ConnectionRef1 =
 1565:                 ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1566:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1567:                                                   {password, "potatis"},
 1568:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1569:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1570: 	    {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1571:                                                   {save_accepted_host, false},
 1572:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1573:                                                   {password, "morot"},
 1574:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1575:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1576: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1577: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef1),
 1578: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1579: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid1);
 1580: 	Error ->
 1581: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1582: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1583: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
 1584:     end.
 1585: 
 1586: no_sensitive_leak(Config) ->
 1587:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1588:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1589:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1590:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1591: 
 1592:     %% Save old, and set new log level:
 1593:     #{level := Level} = logger:get_primary_config(),
 1594:     logger:set_primary_config(level, info),
 1595:     %% Define a collect fun:
 1596:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1597:     Collect = 
 1598:         fun G(N,Nf,Nt) ->
 1599:                 receive
 1600:                     {Ref, false, _} ->
 1601:                         G(N+1, Nf+1, Nt);
 1602:                     {Ref, true, R} ->
 1603:                         ct:log("Report leaked:~n~p", [R]),
 1604:                         G(N+1, Nf, Nt+1)
 1605:                 after 100 ->
 1606:                         {N, Nf, Nt}
 1607:                 end
 1608:         end,
 1609:  
 1610:     %% Install the test handler:
 1611:     Hname = no_sensitive_leak,
 1612:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(Hname,
 1613:                            fun(#{msg := {report,#{report := Rep}}}, Pid) ->
 1614:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1615:                                    Pid ! {Ref,ssh_log_h:sensitive_in_opt(Rep),Rep};
 1616:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1617:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1618:                                    ok
 1619:                            end,
 1620:                            self()),
 1621: 
 1622:     {_Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1623: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1624: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1625: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1626: 
 1627:     _ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1628: 						       {user, "foo"},
 1629: 						       {password, "morot"},
 1630: 						       {user_interaction, true},
 1631: 						       {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1632:     %% Kill acceptor to make it restart:
 1633:     [true|_] =
 1634:         [exit(Pacc,kill) || {{ssh_system_sup,_},P1,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup),
 1635:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},P2,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P1),
 1636:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},Pacc,worker,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P2)],
 1637:     
 1638:     %% Remove the test handler and reset the logger level:
 1639:     timer:sleep(500),
 1640:     logger:remove_handler(Hname),
 1641:     logger:set_primary_config(Level),
 1642: 
 1643:     case Collect(0, 0, 0) of
 1644:         {0, 0,   0} -> ct:fail("Logging failed, line = ~p", [?LINE]);
 1645:         {_, _,   0} -> ok;
 1646:         {_, _, Nt0} -> ct:fail("Leak in ~p cases!", [Nt0])
 1647:     end.
 1648:     
 1649: start_subsystem_on_closed_channel(Config) ->
 1650:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1651:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1652:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1653:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1654:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1655: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1656: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1657: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}]),
 1658: 
 1659:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1660: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1661: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1662: 						      {user_interaction, false},
 1663: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1664: 
 1665: 
 1666:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1667:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1),
 1668:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, []),
 1669:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", 5000),
 1670:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1671:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1672: 
 1673:     %% Test that there could be a gap between close and an operation (Bugfix OTP-14939):
 1674:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1675:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2),
 1676:     timer:sleep(2000),
 1677:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, []),
 1678:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "echo_n", 5000),
 1679:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1680:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1681: 
 1682:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1683:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1684: 
 1685: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1686: max_channels_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1687:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1688:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1689:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1690:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1691:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1692: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1693: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1694: 					     {max_channels, 3},
 1695: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}
 1696: 					    ]),
 1697: 
 1698:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1699: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1700: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1701: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1702: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1703: 
 1704:     %% Allocate a number of ChannelId:s to play with. (This operation is not
 1705:     %% counted by the max_channel option).
 1706:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1707:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1708:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1709:     {ok, ChannelId3} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1710:     {ok, ChannelId4} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1711:     {ok, ChannelId5} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1712:     {ok, ChannelId6} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1713:     {ok, _ChannelId7} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1714: 
 1715:     %% Now start to open the channels (this is counted my max_channels) to check that
 1716:     %% it gives a failure at right place
 1717: 
 1718:     %%%---- Channel 1(3): shell
 1719:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId0),
 1720:     receive
 1721: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"Eshell",_/binary>>}} ->
 1722: 	    ok
 1723:     after 5000 ->
 1724: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1725:     end,
 1726: 
 1727:     %%%---- Channel 2(3): subsystem "echo_n"
 1728:     success = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", infinity),
 1729: 
 1730:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): exec. This closes itself.
 1731:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", infinity),
 1732:     receive
 1733: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId2, 0, <<"testing1",_/binary>>}} ->
 1734: 	    ok
 1735:     after 5000 ->
 1736: 	    ct:fail("Exec #1 Timeout")
 1737:     end,
 1738: 
 1739:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): subsystem "echo_n" (Note that ChannelId2 should be closed now)
 1740:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId3, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1741: 
 1742:     %%%---- Channel 4(3) !: exec  This should fail
 1743:     failure = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId4, "testing2.\n", infinity),
 1744: 
 1745:     %%%---- close the shell (Frees one channel)
 1746:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1747:     
 1748:     %%%---- wait for the subsystem to terminate
 1749:     receive
 1750: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef,{closed,ChannelId0}} -> ok
 1751:     after 5000 ->
 1752: 	    ct:log("Timeout waiting for '{ssh_cm,~p,{closed,~p}}'~n"
 1753: 		   "Message queue:~n~p",
 1754: 		   [ConnectionRef,ChannelId0,erlang:process_info(self(),messages)]),
 1755: 	    ct:fail("exit Timeout",[])
 1756:     end,
 1757: 
 1758:     %%---- Try that we can open one channel instead of the closed one
 1759:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId5, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1760: 
 1761:     %%---- But not a fourth one...
 1762:     failure = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId6, "echo_n", infinity),
 1763: 
 1764:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1765:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1766: 
 1767: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1768: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 1769: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1770: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef) ->
 1771:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 1).
 1772: 
 1773: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, N) ->
 1774:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1775:     Cmd = "yes testing | head -n " ++ integer_to_list(N),
 1776:     ct:log("Cmd to be invoked over SSH shell: ~p", [Cmd]),
 1777:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Cmd, infinity),
 1778:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 1779:     case N of
 1780:         1 ->
 1781:             %% receive response to input
 1782:             receive
 1783:                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, ExpectedBin}} ->
 1784:                     ok
 1785:             after
 1786:                 10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1787:             end;
 1788:         _ ->
 1789:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1790:     end,
 1791: 
 1792:     %% receive close messages
 1793:     receive
 1794: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
 1795: 	    ok
 1796:     after
 1797: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1798:     end,
 1799:     receive
 1800: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
 1801: 	    ok
 1802:     after
 1803: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1804:     end,
 1805:     receive
 1806: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
 1807: 	    ok
 1808:     after
 1809: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1810:     end.
 1811: 
 1812: 
 1813: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1814: flush_msgs() ->
 1815:     flush_msgs([]).
 1816: 
 1817: flush_msgs(Unexpected) ->
 1818:     receive
 1819:         M ->
 1820:             case lists:member(M, Unexpected) of
 1821:                 true ->
 1822:                     ct:fail("Unexpected message found:  ~p", [M]);
 1823:                 _ ->
 1824:                     flush_msgs()
 1825:             end
 1826:     after
 1827:         500 -> ok
 1828:     end.
 1829: 
 1830: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1831: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1832:     test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Prohibited.">>, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1833: 
 1834: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, NotExpect) ->
 1835:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1836:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef, ChannelId),
 1837:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1838:     NotExpSz = size(NotExpect),
 1839:     receive
 1840:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 1, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1841:             flush_msgs();
 1842: 
 1843:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<NotExpect:NotExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1844:             ct:fail("Could start disabled shell!");
 1845: 
 1846:         R ->
 1847:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1848:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, '0|1', Expect}} ]),
 1849:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1850: 
 1851:     after 5000 ->
 1852:             ct:fail("Shell Timeout")
 1853:     end.
 1854: 
 1855: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1856: test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1857:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1858:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "1+2.", infinity),
 1859:     receive
 1860:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ->
 1861:             flush_msgs();
 1862:         R ->
 1863:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1864:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ]),
 1865:             ct:fail("Could exec erlang term although non-erlang shell")
 1866:     after 5000 ->
 1867:             ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1868:     end.
 1869: 
 1870: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1871: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1872:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1873: 
 1874: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect) ->
 1875:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, []).
 1876: 
 1877: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, PtyOpts) ->
 1878:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1879:     case PtyOpts of
 1880:         [] ->
 1881:             no_alloc;
 1882:         _ ->
 1883:             success = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, PtyOpts)
 1884:     end,
 1885:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
 1886: 
 1887:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1888:     receive
 1889: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1890: 	    flush_msgs();
 1891: 
 1892:         R ->
 1893:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1894:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ]),
 1895:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1896: 
 1897:     after 5000 ->
 1898: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1899:     end.
 1900: 
 1901: 
 1902: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1903:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, "1+2.", <<"3">>).
 1904: 
 1905: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Exec, Expect) ->
 1906:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1907:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Exec, infinity),
 1908:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1909:     receive
 1910:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} = R ->
 1911:             ct:log("~p:~p Got expected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,R]);
 1912:         Other ->
 1913:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1914:                    [?MODULE,?LINE, Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ])
 1915:     after 5000 ->
 1916:             {fail,"Exec Timeout"}
 1917:     end.
 1918: 
 1919: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1920: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId) ->
 1921:     big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []).
 1922: 
 1923: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Acc) ->
 1924:     receive
 1925: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} ->
 1926: 	    %% ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, size(Data)),
 1927: 	    %% window was pre-adjusted, don't adjust again here
 1928: 	    big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, [Data | Acc]);
 1929: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
 1930: 	    {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))}
 1931:     after ?EXEC_TIMEOUT ->
 1932: 	    timeout
 1933:     end.
 1934: 
 1935: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize) ->
 1936:     ct:log("~p:~p Listener ~p running! ConnectionRef=~p, ChannelId=~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,self(),ConnectionRef,ChannelId]),
 1937:     collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [], 0).
 1938: 
 1939: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum) ->
 1940:     TO = 5000,
 1941:     receive
 1942: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} when is_binary(Data) ->
 1943: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p bytes. total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 1944: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,size(Data),Sum+size(Data),EchoSize-Sum]),
 1945:             %% FIXME - maybe line below not needed with client auto adjusting window?
 1946: 	    ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, size(Data)),
 1947: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [Data | Acc], Sum+size(Data));
 1948: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={eof, ChannelId}} ->
 1949: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 1950: 
 1951: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={closed,ChannelId}} ->
 1952: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 1953: 
 1954: 	Msg ->
 1955: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ***** unexpected message *****~n~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 1956: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 1957: 
 1958:     after TO ->
 1959: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ----- Nothing received for ~p seconds -----~n",[?MODULE,?LINE,TO]),
 1960: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 1961:     end.
 1962: 
 1963: collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize) ->
 1964:     try
 1965: 	iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))
 1966:     of
 1967: 	Bin ->
 1968: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nGot in total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 1969: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,size(Bin),EchoSize,size(Bin)]),
 1970: 	    Bin
 1971:     catch
 1972: 	C:E ->
 1973: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nAcc is strange...~nException=~p:~p~nAcc=~p",
 1974: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,C,E,Acc]),
 1975: 	    {error,{C,E}}
 1976:     end.
 1977: 
 1978: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
 1979: %% This is taken from the ssh example code.
 1980: start_our_shell(_User, _Peer) ->
 1981:     spawn(fun() ->
 1982: 		  io:format("Enter command\n")
 1983: 		  %% Don't actually loop, just exit
 1984:           end).
 1985: 
 1986: start_our_shell2(_User, _Peer) ->
 1987:     spawn(fun() ->
 1988:                   io:format("Enter command\n"),
 1989:                   read_write_loop1("> ", 1)
 1990:           end).
 1991: 
 1992: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd) ->
 1993:     spawn(fun() ->
 1994:                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 1995:           end).
 1996: 
 1997: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd, User) ->
 1998:     spawn(fun() ->
 1999:                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 2000:           end).
 2001: 
 2002: receive_bytes(_, _, 0, _) ->
 2003:     ct:log("ALL DATA RECEIVED Budget = 0"),
 2004:     ct:log("================================ ExpectBudget = 0 (reception completed)"),
 2005:     ok;
 2006: receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Budget, AccSize) when Budget > 0 ->
 2007:     receive
 2008:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, D}} ->
 2009:             Fmt = "================================ ExpectBudget = "
 2010:                 "~p bytes Received/Total = ~p/~p bytes",
 2011:             Args = [Budget, byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D)],
 2012:             ct:log(Fmt, Args),
 2013:             %% ct:log(Fmt, Args),
 2014:             %% ?DBG_TERM(D),
 2015:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 2016:                           Budget - byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D))
 2017:     after
 2018:         10000 ->
 2019:             ct:log("process_info(self(), messages) = ~p",
 2020:                    [process_info(self(), messages)]),
 2021:             ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2022:     end.
